org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin

Class AbstractLocalReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.util.Observable<T>
      • org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractObservableReader
        • org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractLocalReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<SeReader>, ObservableReader, ProxyReader, SeReader, Configurable, Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSelectionLocalReader, AbstractStaticReader

    public abstract class AbstractLocalReader
extends AbstractObservableReader
    Manage the loop processing for SeRequest transmission in a set and for SeResponse reception in a set

    • Field Detail

      • protocolsMap

        protected java.util.Map<SeProtocol,java.lang.String> protocolsMap
        PO selection map associating seProtocols and selection strings.

        The String associated with a particular protocol can be anything that is relevant to be interpreted by reader plugins implementing protocolFlagMatches (e.g. ATR regex for Pcsc plugins, technology name for Nfc plugins, etc).

      • name

        protected final java.lang.String name
        The item name (must be unique)

        Reader constructor

        Force the definition of a name through the use of super method.

        Initialize the time measurement

        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin that instantiated the reader
        readerName - the name of the reader

    • Method Detail

      • isSePresent

        public final boolean isSePresent()
                          throws NoStackTraceThrowable
        Check the presence of a SE

        This method is recommended for non-observable readers.

        When the card is not present the logical and physical channels status may be refreshed through a call to the cardRemoved method.

        Returns:
        true if the SE is present
        Throws:
        NoStackTraceThrowable - a exception without stack trace in order to be catched and processed silently

      • checkSePresence

        protected abstract boolean checkSePresence()
                                    throws NoStackTraceThrowable
        Wrapper for the native method of the plugin specific local reader to verify the presence of the SE.

        This method must be implemented by the ProxyReader plugin (e.g. Pcsc reader plugin).

        This method is invoked by isSePresent.

        Returns:
        true if the SE is present
        Throws:
        NoStackTraceThrowable - exception without stack trace

      • cardInserted

        protected final void cardInserted()
        This method is invoked when a SE is inserted in the case of an observable reader.

        e.g. from the monitoring thread in the case of a Pcsc plugin (AbstractThreadedLocalReader)) or from the NfcAdapter callback method onTagDiscovered in the case of a Android NFC plugin.

        It will fire an ReaderEvent in the following cases:

        • SE_INSERTED: if no default selection request was defined
        • SE_MATCHED: if a default selection request was defined in any mode and a SE matched the selection
        • SE_INSERTED: if a default selection request was defined in ALWAYS mode but no SE matched the selection (the SelectionResponse is however transmitted)

        It will do nothing if a default selection is defined in MATCHED_ONLY mode but no SE matched the selection.

      • cardRemoved

        protected final void cardRemoved()
                          throws NoStackTraceThrowable
        This method is invoked when a SE is removed in the case of an observable reader (AbstractThreadedLocalReader).

        It will also be invoked if isSePresent is called and at least one of the physical or logical channels is still open (case of a non-observable reader)

        The SE will be notified removed only if it has been previously notified present (observable reader only)

        Throws:
        NoStackTraceThrowable

      • openLogicalChannelAndSelect

        protected abstract SelectionStatus openLogicalChannelAndSelect(SeRequest.Selector selector,
                                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> successfulSelectionStatusCodes)
                                                        throws KeypleApplicationSelectionException,
                                                               KeypleReaderException
        This abstract method must be implemented by the class that provides the selection mechanism (e.g AbstractThreadedLocalReader or AndroidOmapiReader).

        Its role is to open (if needed) a physical channel and try to establish a logical channel.

        The logical opening is done either by sending a Select Application command (AID based selection) or by checking the current ATR received from the SE (ATR based selection).

        If the selection is successful, the logical channel is considered open. On the contrary, if the selection fails, the logical channel remains closed.

        Parameters:
        selector - the SE Selector: either the AID of the application to select or an ATR selection regular expression
        successfulSelectionStatusCodes - the list of successful status code for the select command
        Returns:
        a SelectionStatus object containing the SE ATR, the SE FCI and a flag giving the selection process result. When ATR or FCI are not available, they are set to null but they can't be both null at the same time.
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - if a reader error occurs
        KeypleApplicationSelectionException - if the application selection fails

      • closePhysicalChannel

        protected abstract void closePhysicalChannel()
                                      throws KeypleChannelStateException
        Closes the current physical channel.

        This method must be implemented by the ProxyReader plugin (e.g. Pcsc/Nfc/Omapi Reader).

        Throws:
        KeypleChannelStateException - if a reader error occurs

      • isPhysicalChannelOpen

        protected abstract boolean isPhysicalChannelOpen()
        Tells if the physical channel is open or not

        This method must be implemented by the ProxyReader plugin (e.g. Pcsc/Nfc/Omapi Reader).

        Returns:
        true is the channel is open

      • addSeProtocolSetting

        public void addSeProtocolSetting(SeProtocolSetting seProtocolSetting)
        Defines the protocol setting Map to allow SE to be differentiated according to their communication protocol.
        Parameters:
        seProtocolSetting - the protocol setting to be added to the plugin internal list

      • protocolFlagMatches

        protected abstract boolean protocolFlagMatches(SeProtocol protocolFlag)
                                        throws KeypleReaderException
        Test if the current protocol matches the provided protocol flag.

        The method must be implemented by the ProxyReader plugin.

        The protocol flag is used to retrieve from the protocolsMap the String used to differentiate this particular protocol. (e.g. in PC/SC the only way to identify the SE protocol is to analyse the ATR returned by the reader [ISO SE and memory card SE have specific ATR], in Android Nfc the SE protocol can be deduced with the TagTechnology interface).

        Parameters:
        protocolFlag - the protocol flag
        Returns:
        true if the current protocol matches the provided protocol flag
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - in case of a reader exception

      • processSeRequestSet

        protected final SeResponseSet processSeRequestSet(SeRequestSet requestSet)
                                           throws KeypleReaderException
        Do the transmission of all needed requestSet requests contained in the provided requestSet according to the protocol flag selection logic. The responseSet responses are returned in the responseSet object. The requestSet requests are ordered at application level and the responses match this order. When a requestSet is not matching the current PO, the responseSet responses pushed in the responseSet object is set to null.
        Specified by:
        processSeRequestSet in class AbstractObservableReader
        Parameters:
        requestSet - the request set
        Returns:
        SeResponseSet the response set
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - if a reader error occurs
        KeypleReaderException - if reader error occurs

      • processSeRequest

        protected final SeResponse processSeRequest(SeRequest seRequest)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                            KeypleReaderException
        Executes a request made of one or more Apdus and receives their answers. The selection of the application is handled.

        The physical channel is closed if requested.

        Specified by:
        processSeRequest in class AbstractObservableReader
        Parameters:
        seRequest - the SeRequest
        Returns:
        the SeResponse to the SeRequest
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - if a transmission fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • processApduRequest

        protected final ApduResponse processApduRequest(ApduRequest apduRequest)
                                         throws KeypleIOReaderException
        Transmits an ApduRequest and receives the ApduResponse

        The time measurement is carried out and logged with the detailed information of the exchanges (TRACE level).

        Parameters:
        apduRequest - APDU request
        Returns:
        APDU response
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - Exception faced

      • transmitApdu

        protected abstract byte[] transmitApdu(byte[] apduIn)
                                throws KeypleIOReaderException
        Transmits a single APDU and receives its response.

        This abstract method must be implemented by the ProxyReader plugin (e.g. Pcsc, Nfc). The implementation must handle the case where the SE response is 61xy and execute the appropriate get response command.

        Parameters:
        apduIn - byte buffer containing the ingoing data
        Returns:
        apduResponse byte buffer containing the outgoing data.
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - if the transmission fails

      • setDefaultSelectionRequest

        public void setDefaultSelectionRequest(SelectionRequest defaultSelectionRequest,
                                       ObservableReader.NotificationMode notificationMode)
        If defined, the prepared setDefaultSelectionRequest will be processed as soon as a SE is inserted. The result of this request set will be added to the reader event.

        Depending on the notification mode, the observer will be notified whenever an SE is inserted, regardless of the selection status, or only if the current SE matches the selection criteria.

        Parameters:
        defaultSelectionRequest - the SelectionRequest to be executed when a SE is inserted
        notificationMode - the notification mode enum (ALWAYS or MATCHED_ONLY)

      • notifyObservers

        public final void notifyObservers(T event)

        Throws:
